En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará tratamientos capilares y productos cosméticos, así como una vitrina para mantener bien ordenado su inventario. El éxito de su credikiva es su gran experiencia y el logro de disminuir sus costos, comprando de contado y en mayor volumen y justamente eso es lo que persigue Leyla.
texts.en:
Leyla, 47, lives in the city of Cartagena de Indias with her spouse and three children whose ages range from 5 to 21 years.  She has a beauty shop there where she offers image enhancing services to all the surrounding families.  Her business started when she took an evening barber course at the age of 16 while working days because the teacher hired her when she saw her enthusiasm and capacity for applying the skills she was learning.  She gained vast experience this way and sometime later capitalized her business and has it to this day.  

She started out buying her work tools with her own income and continued taking refresher beauty courses and gradually expanded her growth possibilities; she purchased furnishings to organize her sales point.  Her drive for advancement led to her opening an academy and she taught courses.  Later on she became still better-known and she got a job that required her to travel frequently so she changed her business for a good job.  Five years after that, though, she returned to her original idea of having her own business.  She’s done very well with this one and she simultaneously generates income by selling merchandise, especially those associated with beauty.  She’s a beauty consultant and sells cosmetics and hair products at the same time and this is what her customers like best.

She’s currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy hair treatments and cosmetics as well as a display case to keep her inventory well-organized.  Her Kiva loan’s success rests on her vast experience and her managing to lower costs by being able to pay cash for larger amounts which is precisely what Leyla is pursuing.

loans.use: to buy hair products and cosmetics.

loans.name: Nasriddin

texts.ru:
Насриддин житель района Рудаки. Ему 41 год. Он женат. Насриддин является отцом двоих детей. Он пекарь. Он открыл пекарню. В этой области Насриддин десять лет. У него работают двое человек в качестве помощников. Он печет хлеб для продажи. 
Насриддин берет кредит для ремонта пекарни, покупки муки и дров.
texts.en:
Nasridin is a 41-year-old resident of the Rudaki region. He is the father of two children. 

Nasridin has been working as a baker for ten years. He has his own bakery, where he employs two people and bakes bread for sale. Nasridin is requesting this loan to renovate his bakery and purchase flour and yeast.

loans.use: to renovate his bakery and purchase flour and yeast

loans.name: Vicente Ramon

texts.es: Vicente Ramón de 47 anos de edad, casado, de la localidad de León, tiene por actividad económica la elaboración de ladrillos de barro. El negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación desde hace 22 anos que se dedica a dicho negocio. Negocio que surgió por la necesidad de tener una fuente de trabajo para mejorar los ingresos de su familia. Vicente Ramón ya ha tenido crédito con fundación y ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma. El objetivo del préstamo es para invertir en materia prima como tierra, arena, abarro para la elaboración de ladrillos de barro. Vicente Ramón agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les ofrecen  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener fuentes de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Vicente Ramón is 47 years old, married, and from the town of Leon. His work is making clay bricks. The business is located in his home, and he has been in this business for 22 years. It came about because of his need to have a source of work, in order to improve his family's income. 

Vicente Ramón has already had credit with the Foundation, and has shown his responsibility by making payments in a timely manner. The purpose of the loan is to invest in raw materials such as earth, sand and clay for making clay bricks. 

Vicente Ramón is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to low-income people and to poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that people can have a decent livelihood.

loans.use: To invest in working capital and buy raw material for making clay bricks, such as sand, earth and clay.

loans.name: Sandy

texts.es: Sandy, de 23 años es una mujer amable y soñadora. Vive en la casa de su suegra junto a su conviviente Jorge quien trabaja en una compañía de gas. Tienen un hijo de 2 años y piensan darle una buena educación. El trabajo de Sandy consiste en la venta de bebidas gasificadas como gaseosas de distintos sabores y cervezas de diferentes marcas; asimismo vende golosinas  como  chicles, caramelos, galletas,  etc. Este trabajo lo realiza en un local en el  interior de la vivienda de su suegra. Lleva 2 años en este negocio, anhelo que lo logró concretarlo desde que tenía 20 años, pues vendía refresco con su mamá y de ahí tuvo la idea de tener su propio negocio. En su actividad económica su conviviente la ayuda hacer las compras para abastecer  su negocio y su suegra la ayuda en la atención a los clientes. Comenta que su  actividad es rentable porque cada tarde en el  frontis de su negocio se reúnen  muchas de sus vecinas  para jugar bingo y son las que consumen en grandes cantidades los productos que tiene a la venta. Comenta que antes de empezar con este negocio, no contaba con local propio y tenia que trasladarse de un lugar a otro, entonces su suegra le ofreció su vivienda para que inicie su negocio. Para el futuro quiere terminar de construir, ambientar un local para la mejor atención de sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias. Por tanto solcita 1200 soles, que lo utilizará para comprar  en mayor volumen, gaseosas de distintos sabores, cervezas de diferentes marcas, así como también comprará golosinas  como  chicles, caramelos, galletas,  etc.
texts.en:
Sandy, 23, is a kind woman with dreams.  She lives in her mother-in-law’s house with her spouse, Jorge, who works for a gas company.  They have a two-year-old son they plan to give a good education.  Sandy’s work consists in selling carbonated soft-drinks in assorted flavors and various brands of beer; she also sells snacks like chewing gum, candy, cookies, etc.  She does this work in a space located in her mother-in-law’s house.  

She’s had the business for two years, a dream she made reality at the age of 20 since she sold soft-drinks with her mother and that’s where she got the idea for her own business.  Her spouse helps make the purchases to stock her economic activity and her mother-in-law helps with customer service.  She comments that her activity is profitable because every afternoon many neighbors gather in front of her house to play bingo and they consume large quantities of the products she has for sale.  

She comments that before starting this business she did not have a space of her own and had to go from place to place but then her mother-in-law offered her house so she could start her business.  In future, she wants to finish building and furnishing her locale to provide better customer service and increase her profits which is why she’s asking for a 1,200 sol loan to buy larger amounts of soft-drinks in assorted flavors and beer of various brands as well as to buy snacks like chewing gum, candy, cookies, etc.

loans.use: to buy carbonated soft-drinks, beer and snacks like chewing gum, candy and cookies.

loans.name: Burulcha

texts.ru: Бурулча 40 лет. Бурулча родила и воспитала 3 детей. Сейчас в месте с Бурулча живут все вместе. Старший сын помогает по хозяйству. Заёмщик имеет среднее образование. После окончаний школы вышла замуж.Бизнесом занимается давно, около 15 лет назад. Начала она свой бизнес с 5,000 KGS. В данный момент семья продолжает заниматься полеводством и животноводством, у них есть 2 коровы, 1 теленок, 1 лошадь и 5 овец. Дополнительным источником дохода Бурулча является реализация молока с дома.Ежемесячный доход семьи составляет около 17,000 KGS. По характеру Бурулча очень активный и трудолюбивый человек.  Бурулча обратилась в Компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для приобретения скота.Она планирует купить телят и овец. В будущем Бурулча собирается увеличить поголовье скота и улучшить материальное положение семьи и сделать дома ремонт.
texts.en:
Burulcha is 40 years old. She is a mother and has raised 3 children, all of whom currently live with her. Her oldest son helps his mother run the household. Burulcha has secondary education. She got married after graduating from high school. She is a very active and hard-working person.

Burulcha has been an entrepreneur for a long time, nearly 15 years. She started her business with 5,000 KGS. Today, the family continues farming and raising livestock: they keep 2 cows, 1 calf, 1 horse, and 5 sheep. As an additional source of income, Burulcha sells milk from her home. The family's monthly income is roughly 17,000 KGS.

Burulcha has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock. She plans to buy calves and sheep. In the future, Burulcha plans to further increase the size of her herd, as well as improve her family's financial situation and carry out repairs in their home.

loans.use: to purchase calves and sheep

loans.name: Digna

texts.es:
Digna, de 39 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, está casada con Rubén y juntos tienes 3 hijos de 24. 21 y 11 años de edad respectivamente, vive en su casa propia junto a toda su familia. 
El trabajo de Digna consiste en la venta al por menor de productos de primera necesidad, entre los que se encuentran; arroz, azúcar, leche, panes, huevos, aceite, verduras y mas. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa en donde atiende todos los días y a tiempo completo. Lleva trabajando recién 1 año en este rubro. Al inicio tuvo la ayuda de su esposo pero ahora se dedica ella misma a tiempo completo a atender a su clientela. Complementa su bodega con la venta diferentes prendas de vestir, zapatos y cosméticos. 
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para cumplir otras actividades eventuales entre ellas las principales funciones de su hogar, afortunadamente le va muy bien ya que siempre tienen clientes debido a la variedad de productos que ofrece y porque además en la única bodega en su barrio,por lo que espera poder seguir surgiendo y hacer crecer su negocio. Este es el crédito número 20 con MFP, agradece a quienes le brindan la oportunidad para acceder a este crédito financiero que le brinda la seguridad para continuar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual ya que no desea dejar una imagen negativa en los miembros de su grupo que se caracterizan por la puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos.
Con el monto solicitado 1300 soles, comprará mercadería para su venta en su bodega conformada por golosinas, arroz, azúcar, panes, huevos, leche, aceites verduras y otros
texts.en:
Digna, 39, is an enterprising woman who very much wants to get ahead.  She’s married to Rubén and they have three children together who are 24, 21, and 11 years of age respectively; she lives with her entire family in a house of her own.  Digna’s work consists in selling at retail basic staple items among which are rice, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, oil, vegetables and more.  She has this business located at home and she tends to it full-time, every day.  She’s been in this line of work for just a year.  At the beginning, she had her husband’s help but now she herself tends to her customers full-time.  She complements her store with the sale of clothing, shoes and cosmetics.

What she likes about her work is that she has time to do other occasional chores especially her household chores.  Fortunately, she does very well because they always have customer due to the variety of products she stocks and also because hers is the only grocery store in the neighborhood so she expects to be able to continue surging forward and to make her business grow too.

This is MFP loan #20 and she thanks all those who provide her with the opportunity of accessing this loan that insures her being able to stay in business.  On the other hand, she commits once again to make her payments punctually because she does not want to leave a negative impression with her fellow group members who have been noted for the punctuality and responsibility of their payments.  She will use the requested 1,300 soles to buy stock merchandise like snacks, rice, sugar, bread, eggs, milk, oil, vegetables and others for her store.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, bread, eggs, milk, oil, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Toktobubu

texts.ru: Токтобубу 56 лет, замужем, мать 7 детей.Токтобубу является матерью героиней. Токтобубу в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи с 1976 года начала заниматься животноводством. Начатый с суммы 1,000 KGS бизнес благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости Токтобубу, на сегодня насчитывает 3 доеные коровы, 20 голов овец и 12 лошадей и приносит доход около 15,000 - 20,000 сом в месяц с продажи  скота и молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Токтобубу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 45,000 сом (KGS) на покупку кормов для скота. Что позволит прокормить животных в течении зимы.На средства полученные от реализации скота будущей осенью, она планирует завершить строительство дома в селе.
texts.en:
Toktobubu is a 56-year-old married mother of seven. She is a super mom. Since 1976 she has been working in animal husbandry and providing the main source of income for her family. She started her business with 1,000 som. Thanks to hard work and persistence, she now has a total of three dairy cows, 20 sheep, and 12 horses. Her monthly profit from the sale of cattle and dairy products is between 15,000 and 20,000 som. 

With long term business development in mind, Toktobubu turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 45,000 som to purchase fodder for her cattle to feed them through winter. When she sells the cattle next fall, she plans to complete the construction of her home in the village.

loans.use: To purchase fodder for cattle

loans.name: Nurjamal

texts.ru: Нуржамал 56 лет,вдова, мать 3 детей.После распада СССР Нуржамал получила часть своей земли. Нуржамал  в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи с 1991 года начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством. Начатый с суммы 1,000 KGS бизнес, благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости Нуржамал , на сегодня насчитывает 1 корова, 5 голов овец и 2 лошадей и приносит доход около 20,000 - 30,000 сом в месяц. Кроме этого  на 3,6 га земли Нуржамал  ежегодно сажает клевер и ячмень. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нуржамал  обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. На средства полученные от реализации скота будущей осенью, она планирует построить большой сарай.
texts.en:
Nurjamal is a 56-year-old widow and mother of three. After the fall of the Soviet Union, Nurjamal was given part of her land. Since 1991 she has worked in animal husbandry and crop farming, providing the main source of income for her family. She started her business with 1,000 som and thanks to hard work and persistence she now has a total of one cow, five sheep, and two horses, which provide her with a monthly income of 20,000 - 30,000 som. Additionally, she plants clover and barley on 3.6 hectares of land annually. 

With long term business development in mind, Nurjamal turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 som to purchase cattle. When she sells her cattle next fall, she plans to build a large shed.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es: Nidia compró víveres con los cuales surtió su tienda, con ello se han incrementado las ventas y sus ingresos también, su local ahora tiene una mejor infraestructura. Su sueño más adelante es hacer su casa de dos plantas, para ubicar la tienda en el primer piso y a su familia en el segundo. Ella envía  agradecimientos a Kiva , porque dice que “sin estos préstamos quedaría estancada y no podría seguir avanzando”. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará víveres, rancho, refrescos y  licores , pues conoce por experiencia que preparándose para las fiestas del año nuevo y las navidades,  hará de su credikiva la mejor  la mejor inversión.
texts.en:
Nidia bought groceries with which she stocked her store. With this, sales have increased and also her income. Her shop now has better infrastructure. Her dream for the future is to add a floor to her home so that she can locate her store on the first floor and her family on the second. She sends her thanks to Kiva because she says that, "Without these loans I would be at a standstill, and wouldn't be able to keep moving forward."

Now she is applying for new credikiva loan, with which she will buy groceries, snacks, soft drinks and alcoholic beverages. She knows by experience that getting ready for the Christmas and end-of-year holidays will make her credikiva loan the best investment.

loans.use: To buy groceries, snacks, soft drinks and alcoholic beverages.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar tiene 51 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene una hija a su cargo.  Vive en casa propia ubicada en el distrito Nueva Arica, perteneciente a la provincia de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

Pilar se dedica desde hace más de 15 años a la venta de abarrotes en general en una bodega instalada en la parte delantera de su casa.  En ese tiempo ha logrado captar mayor número de clientes nuevos, quienes la prefieren por su buen trato y disposición para ayudarlos y servirlos.  Paralelamente percibe ingresos por jubilación, con lo cual mantiene a su familia.

Pilar necesita comprar mayor cantidad de abarrotes en general y comprar cerveza para su posterior venta.  Es por ello que ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para lograr su objetivo.  Con esta inversión podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia además de mejorar su negocio.

Pilar cuenta con buenas referencias personales.
texts.en:
Pilar, 51, has a partner and one daughter in her care. She lives in her own home located in the Nueva Arica district, Chiclayo province, capital of Lambayeque department. Pilar has worked selling groceries for more that 15 years in a small store in the front part of her house. During this time, she has gained a lot of new customers, who prefer her for her good manner and disposition to help them and serve them. At the same time, she receives retirement income, with which she maintains her family. 

Pilar needs to buy a greater quantity of groceries and beer to later sell it. This is why she has applied for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to reach her goal. With this investment, she will be able to improve her and her family's quality of life as well as improve her business. Pilar has good personal references.

loans.use: to buy groceries (rice, sugar, noodles, etc) and beer to sell

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos tiene 53 años de edad y vive junto a su conviviente en casa propia ubicada en el Caserío Lagartera, en Mórrope, una zona rural que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra situada aproximadamente a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 15 años, Santos se dedica a compra y venta de animales menores, los cuales engorda y al alcanzar su tamaño y peso ideal, los comercializa en el mercado de su zona y a los comerciantes que llegan por su localidad.  Adicionalmente trabaja como jornalero en chacras, se dedica a la elaboración de adobes y construye casas de material rústico.  Con sus ingresos saca adelante a su familia.

Santos desea comprar alimento para sus animales, además de colocar piso en una pieza en su domicilio.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 4000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.

Santos cuenta con suficiente ganado para satisfacer la demanda en esta campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Santos is 53 years old and lives with his partner in their own home, located in the rural settlement of Lagartera, in Mórrope,  a rural area which is part of the province of Lambayeque, and is located approximately one hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Santos has been buying and selling smaller animals for 15 years. He fattens them, and when they reach their ideal size and weight, sells them in the local market to merchants who visit his area. As well, he works as a day laborer on farms, makes adobe bricks, and builds houses from local materials.

Santos wishes to buy food for his animals, and also to install a floor in a room in his home. This is why he has felt it necessary to apply to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 4000 nuevos soles.

Santos has enough livestock to meet the demand in this Christmas season.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed, and install a floor in a room in his home.

loans.name: Silvia Eugenia

texts.en:
Silvia is pursuing a law degree at San Franciso Xavier University. She is studying law because she believes that it is a field that will help her country progress and one that will allow her to help herself and her family live a better life. Without access to this student loan, she would need to focus less on her studies and direct her attention towards finding someone to help pay her tuition or risk having to drop out of school. For Silvia, a degree is an opportunity to earn a professional position and a professional paycheck. Putting school on hold would prolong her current financial situation, something she desperately wants to change. 

Without the loan, Silvia thinks that she would need to ask her parents or other family members but worries that this may not be possible because her father is the only income generator in their family. He works as a carpenter while her mother tends to the house and family. Both her parents were only able to complete their primary education before they needed to enter the workforce. This loan will help Silvia to focus on finishing her law degree and become the professional that she aspires to be.

Silvia has two brothers and one sister, but she will be the first student in her family to earn her college degree. She hopes to be an example for her siblings. With multiple college-educated people in the family, Silvia feels hopefully that together her siblings can change her family’s status and provide a comfortable life for each other. She currently earns $350 per year, but she hopes to earn over $6,000 annually after she graduates. Silvia wants her lenders to know that Sucre, the city where her university is located in, has many students and that this youngsters are very important to the vitality of the city.

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner Banco Fie.

loans.use: To pay for graduation expenses

loans.name: Ciro Erick

texts.en:
Ciro is studying law at San Fransisco Xavier University in Sucre, Bolivia. He chose law because he finds the discipline very interesting and he has always enjoyed reading. As Bolivia continues to develop, Ciro hopes that a degree in law will prepare him for the challenges ahead and help bring him financial success that he and his family desperately need. Ciro’s mother is retired and his father works as a auditor. With a limited family income, affording school has always been a challenge. Ciro’s younger brother has hopes of earning a university degree as well, and with the promise of success, Ciro hopes to be able to help him afford his own education.

With the money from his student loan Ciro plans to budget it to help pay for his school materials that will help him finish his thesis and the many fees associated with the school’s administration and titles. 

In Bolivia it is common to pay tuition at the end of the semester in form of a exam fee and at the end a four-year degree, in the form of a thesis fee and title fee. Despite having completed all the required work, Ciro fears that if he cannot afford the fees he will be unable to receive his degree. He hopes to not have to postpone his studies. School takes up much of his time and currently Ciro is unable to find a job that is flexible with his school schedule. 

With a degree in law, however, he expects to earn $5208 a year, a salary that would allow him to help support his brothers’ education and his parents’ well-being into the future. Ciro wishes to share that his city of Sucre, is very beautiful with great historical colonial architecture and many lovely museums.

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner Banco Fie.

loans.use: To pay for graduation expenses

loans.name: Juan Alejandro

texts.en:
Juan dreams of becoming a commercial engineer. He is currently enrolled in a degree program at the San Fransisco Xavier University but with his currently financial status he is unable to purchase the materials he needs, which is crippling his performance in school. Juan shares with us that without a computer it is difficult to learn and practice the practical component of his degree and it is inconvenient and even challenging to complete his thesis without consistent access to a computer and the internet. Much of engineering is computer based and without one, he feels that he is falling behind. 

Although Juan is the youngest of two, his household supports eight people in total. While both his parents are college educated, their family finances are very tight. With the aid of a student loan Juan plans to buy a laptop and the books and materials that will help him succeed. He chose commercial engineering because the field interested him and because he perceived a need for it in the job market. He hopes to be able to use his salary to help his family’s finances.

In addition to his classes and study sessions, Juan holds a part time job. Currently he makes around $8,600 a year but with a degree in engineering he hopes to be able to double his salary, maybe even more. The prospect of a secure salary and in turn, a secure future for himself and his family is worth the sacrifice and extra work now. With the security of loan, Juan can be confident that he can afford his full education and be able to help move his life and his family forward.

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner Banco Fie.

loans.use: To purchase a computer and books

loans.name: Esperanza Juliza

texts.es:
Esperanza tiene 41  años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad.  Vive en casa propia en el Caserío Eureka que pertenece a la zona rural del distrito de Lambayeque,  el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 200  familias.

La actividad que desarrolla Esperanza es la crianza y venta de animales, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 20 años, tiempo en el cual ha adquirido bastante experiencia y clientela.  El negocio está situado en su domicilio, aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro.  Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le ayudan a cubrir sus gastos personales y los de su familia.

Esperanza ha solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles, esto le ayudará para invertir en acabados de sus corrales y puesta de portón en su casa.  Este negocio  cuenta con competencia  pero también cuenta con un amplio mercado para su comercialización.
texts.en:
Esperanza is 41 years old, live with her partner, and has two minor children. She lives in her own house in the rural settlement of Eureka, which is part of the rural area of Lambayeque District. This is a small community with approximately 200 families.

The work Esperanza does is raising and selling animals. She has been doing this work for 20 years, in which time she has acquired quite a bit of experience and clientele. The business is located in her home. She learned this work from her parents, so she knows this line of work to perfection. 

The income she earns from this work helps to cover her personal expenses and those of her family.

Esperanza has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles, which will help her invest in doing finishing work on her pens, and putting a gate on her home. This business has competition, but also has a wide market to sell into.

loans.use: To do finishing work on her pens, and install a gate on her home.

loans.name: Ndiaga Laye

texts.fr: Monsieur Ndiaga laye est un jeune célibataire  qui vit au Sénégal. Il s’active depuis plus de 4 ans dans le secteur de la pêche. Il est membre du guichet de l’UIMCEC de sa localité d’habitation. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour le financement de sa cérémonie de mariage. Son souhait est de disposer de beaucoup de pirogues et de moteurs de pêche dans le but de gagner beaucoup de ressources.
texts.en: Mr. Ndiaga Laye is a young single man living in Senegal. For over four years he has been working as a fisherman. He is a member of his local UIMCEC branch. He is seeking a loan of 300,000 West African Francs in order to finance his wedding. His wish is to have many canoes and  motor boats  in order to increase his earnings from fishing.

loans.use: to pay for his wedding expenses.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felícita tiene 26 años de edad, es conviviente y vive junto a su familia en casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Mórrope, zona rural correspondiente a la provincia de Lambayeque.

Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores.  Este negocio se encuentra ubicado en corrales acondicionados en la parte posterior de su domicilio.  Adicionalmente sale a trabajar en diferentes chacras y recibe pagos como jornal.  Su cónyuge percibe ingresos como pescador, actividad que realiza en el puerto de Chimbote.  Con los ingresos de ambos están fortaleciendo su unidad familiar.

Felicita desea comprar alimento balanceado para sus animales, lo cual le permitirá hacer que estos crezcan robustos y estén aptos para el consumo.  Es por ello que ha solicitado un crédito de 3000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Felícita is 26 years old. She lives with her family in their own house located in the Mórrope district. They live in a rural zone in the Province of Lambayeque.

For the last 15 years, Felícita has made a living raising and selling small animals. She runs this business from her home, where she keeps the animals  in air-conditioned pens. Felícita also works on other farms occasionally and receives day wages. Her husband makes a living as a fisherman in the port of Chimbote. Together they are working to help their family. 

Felícita wants to buy animal feed for her animals. This will help them grow bigger so they will be better fit for consumption. That is why she is requesting this loan of 3000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo, de 47 años es un hombre que siempre le gusto hacerle frente a las circunstancias que se le presentan, es así como pudo salir adelante junto a su esposa Doris con quien tiene 3 hijos de 24, 23 y 19 años de edad, viven en una casa propia en donde hasta ahora él sigue esforzándose mucho pues desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Eduardo, a diario se dirige a los aserraderos ubicados en los alrededores de la ciudad para conseguir madera de buena calidad y de los precios mas bajos para ponerlos a la venta en el mismo lugar donde los compra. Tiene clientes que siempre solicitan su mercancía y cuando no tiene no duda en acudir a otro lugar para conseguir lo que le pide su cliente. Lleva en este negocio desde hace 20 años y todo le esta marchando de maravilla. Cumple con esta función todos los días por lo general en las mañanas de lunes a viernes. 
Agradece que las cosas le están yendo muy bien ya que tiene buenos clientes que a diario lo buscan por la calidad de madera que ofrece, espera seguir trabajando de esta manera y más adelante establecer un pequeño aserradero. Este es el crédito número 3 con MFP, está muy contento al saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le brinde la garantía para continuar trabajando con mucha tranquilidad, él por su parte se compromete a seguir siendo puntual en el pago de sus cuotas así como lo hizo en anteriores créditos que tuvo, asimismo se siente cómodo perteneciendo a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 1200 soles, comprará mayor cantidad de maderas traslapadas  que son usadas en construcciones de viviendas.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 47 and a man who has always liked to face up to the circumstances that have arisen. This is how he was able to move forward in life, together with his wife Doris, with whom he has three children, ages 24, 23 and 19. They live in their own home, where he continues to work very hard, as he wishes to provide his family with a better quality of life. 

Each day, Eduardo heads to the sawmills located on the outskirts of the city, to obtain good-quality wood and at lower prices, so that he can put it up for sale in the same place where he buys it. He has customers who always ask for his merchandise, and when he doesn't have something, he doesn't hesitate to go to another place to obtain what his customer is requesting. 

He has been in this business for 20 years, and everything is going extremely well. He performs these tasks every day, generally in the mornings, from Monday to Friday.

He is grateful that things are going very well, as he has good customers who seek him out each day because of the quality of the wood he sells. He hopes to continue working this way, and in the future set up a small sawmill. 

This is his third loan with MFP, and he is very happy knowing that he has financial support, which will provide him the assurance of continuing to work with great peace of mind. For his part, he promises to continue being on time paying his installments, as he was with previous loans he had. As well, he feels comfortable belonging to his communal bank, as all its members are very responsible and supportive. 

With the amount applied for of 1200 soles, he will buy a greater quantity of shiplap cladding, which is used in house construction.

loans.use: To buy a quantity of shiplap cladding, which is used in house construction.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Alicia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tailoring. Alicia is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF, to buy additional items to resell in her store, like shampoo, sugar, noodles and canned goods.

Alicia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to resell, like shampoo, sugar, noodles and canned goods.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 38 years old, married, and has four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a food production and vending business in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF, to buy ingredients for her food business.

Alicia has borrowed and repaid 24 loans from NWTF, before this loan. She has been running the food business for 18 years and also earns an income from raising pigs. Alicia aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Elen

texts.es:
Elen, de 28 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, segura de sí misma y muy trabajadora, está casada con Segundo quien es el padre de sus dos hijos de 13 y 4 años de edad respectivamente.  Vive en compañía de su esposo y sus hijos que son el motivo principal para que ella busque mejorar su calidad de vida, habitan su casa propia la cual logró construir con su cónyuge gracias a mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Elen es la venta de madera, tiene su taller instalado en un amplio espacio de su terreno y ahí se encarga de trabajar con ayuda de su esposo en la fabricación de  piezas de madera para cercos o construcción de viviendas. Trabaja en este rubro más de 15 años porque le brinda buenos ingresos económicos. Le gusta su actividad  porque puede estar en su casa el tiempo necesario para cumplir con las funciones que requiere la crianza de sus hijos sin descuidar sus labores del hogar, también le gusta el ingreso económico que percibe con el cual puede apoyar a su esposo en la solvencia de los gastos de su hogar, espera implementar su local con la producción de una mayor cantidad de piezas de madera además desea comprar algunos equipos de carpintería. Este es el crédito número 11 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su acceso a este financiamiento ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de forma puntual, del mismo modo se siente muy tranquila y respaldada por los integrantes de su banco comunal.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, comprará  maderas, cinceles, lijas y algunas otras piezas usadas en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Elen is 28 years old and a very hardworking and enterprising woman who is sure of herself.  She is married to Segundo, the father of her two children, ages 13 and 14, and lives with her husband and children who are her motivation to search for a better quality of life.  They live in a home of their own which she was able to build with her husband, thanks to lots of effort.

Elen sells lumber and has a workshop in a large space on her land.  She works there with her husband’s help and cuts lumber for fences or for building homes.  She has been doing this for 15 years because it provides a good income and she likes it because she can stay at home to raise her children and to housework.  She also likes the income that she uses to help her husband pay the household expenses.  She wants so set up a shop so she can increase her production and also wants to buy some carpentry equipment.

This will be her 11th loan through MFP and is grateful to those who make this loan possible.  She feels more comfortable about being able to move ahead with her work and promises to make her payments on time.  She feels comfortable and supported by the other members of her communal bank.

She will use the 1,500 PEN from this loan to buy lumber, chisels, sandpaper, and other things she uses in her work.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Creninda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Creninda works hard to support her family.

She has a business of buying and selling bananas in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling dried coconut meat. Creninda is borrowing 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell for her buying and selling bananas business.

Creninda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Berning

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Berning works hard to support her family.

She has a business, buying and selling crabs and shrimp in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from farming rice and selling dried coconut meat. Berning is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more crabs and shrimp to resell.

Berning has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more crabs and shrimps to resell

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has had a mobile fish selling business in the Philippines for 12 years. She also earns some income from raising chickens and ducks.

She is borrowing 27,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Edelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. 

She dreams of saving up enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Edelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from food vending. Edelyn is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks for her tailoring business, like linens, pins, tailoring chalk, etc. 

Edelyn has sustained her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her chidlren to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell

Edna has been in this business for three years.  She earns other income from farming rice.

Edna has sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Braulio

texts.es:
Braulio tiene 40 años de edad, es casado, y tiene 4 hijos como carga familiar. Vive en casa propia hace más de 5 años, junto a su familia. Su domicilio está ubicado en la ciudad de Tambogrande, vive en la parte urbana de este distrito. Y no cuenta con servicios básicos.

La actividad que desarrolla Braulio es la crianza de ovinos y aves de corral como actividad principal, la venta de fruta como actividad secundaria en parcela heredada. Las actividades las desarrolla desde hace más de 3 años, además cuenta con apoyo de conviviente en toda actividad que realiza. Sus hijos lo apoyan en las actividades que realiza, en el pastoreo de ovejas y cabras siendo un gran apoyo en el negocio familiar. 

Braulio desea comprar alimentos balanceados para el engorde de ganado y así poderlos vender a un mejor precio y  también para la compra de mercadería en fruta para así seguir creciendo en su negocio lo cual le permite mejorar su calidad de vida. Es por ello que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles para lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Braulio is 40 years old, married, and has four children whom he is responsible for. He has been living with his family in their own home for more than five years. Their home is located in the city of Tambogrande, and they live in the urban part of this district. They do not have basic services.

Braulio's main work is raising sheep and poultry. He also sells fruit, as a secondary activity, on a parcel of land he inherited. He has been doing these activities for more than three years, and also has his partner's support in all the work that he does. His children support him in his livelihood by shepherding the sheep and goats, and this is a great help to the family business.

Braulio wishes to buy balanced feed for fattening livestock, so that he can sell them for a better price. He also wishes to buy fruit merchandise, so that his business can continue to grow, which will allow him to improve their quality of life. This is why he has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles for achieving his objective.

loans.use: To buy balanced teed for fattening livestock.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 49 years old and married with seven children.

Elena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, spices, noodles, etc.

Elena has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from raising livestock and restaurant.

Elena aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, spices, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store business, like canned goods, coffee, soap, etc.

Erlinda has been in this business for 2 years. Erlinda earns more income from mat making and selling flowers.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store, like canned goods, coffee, soap, etc.

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia is 24 years old and she is married. She runs a business just nearby the main road and very close to a garden where many people come to visit the garden and buy her things from the kiosk. Anastasia is earning a good income. Now she is applying for a loan from TRM (Tuba Rai Mentin) to improve her business. She will purchase some additional supplies for resale with the loan, including soft drinks, hard drinks, oil, biscuits, slippers, and rice.

She hopes to make her business bigger and she wants to live in a better life.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, hard drinks, oil, biscuits, slippers, and rice to resell.

loans.name: Krishna

texts.en:
Krishna is 37 years old. She is married and has three children aged 18, 16 and 14. In 2003, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Krishna plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.  

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk and staples such as rice, lentils and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While typical pasals might be no more than 100 square feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buys grocery goods for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Heberardo

texts.es:
Heberardo tiene 23 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su conviviente y sus 02 menores hijos. La casa está ubicada en el Caserío Platillos en el Distrito de Tambogrande. Cliente vive en la parte rural del distrito, pero cuenta con servicio de luz.

La actividad que desarrolla Heberardo es la agricultura, cuenta con 10 ha que fue herencia de su padre, de la cual tiene constancia de posesión del Teniente Gobernador del caserío, en este terreno siembra maíz 02 veces al año. Complementariamente se dedica a la crianza de ganado menor, cuales al alcanzar peso y tamaño ideal los comercializa en el mercado local.   Con los ingresos que percibe cubre sus gastos y los de su familia.

Heberardo desea comprar para sus cultivos, fertilizantes, agroquímicos y además contratar jornales para su cultivo de maíz.  Es por ello que ha solicitado un crédito de 2500 nuevos soles para lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Heberardo is 22 years old. He lives with his partner and has two children. He lives in his own home with his partner and their two minor children. The home is located in the Caserío, Platillos en the Tambogrande district. He lives in the rural part of the district, but they have electricity. 

Heberardo makes a living in agriculture, given that he inherited 10 hectare from his father, for which he has proof of possession from the Lieutenant Governor of the village. On this land he plants corn two times per year. Additionally, he works raising livestock, which when are the right weight and size are ideal to sell in the local market. With the income, he is able to cover his and his family's expenses. 

Heberardo wants to buy fertilizer and agricultural chemicals for his crops and also wants to hire laborers for their corn crop. This is why he has requested a loan of 2500 soles in order to achieve his goal.

loans.use: purchase balanced food to feed his livestock and purchase zinc sheets for the roof of his barnyard.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
En medio de los grandes retos que tienen los ecuatorianos por sobrevivir a la dura amenaza de la pobreza día con día, allí se halla Sandra, una mujer de 42 años con muchas historias que contar pero que ahora le interesa su presente, su futuro y el de sus hijas, quienes aunque ya son mayores de edad Sandra espera ver que ellas cumplan todos sus sueños ya que para ella fue muy duro no poder terminar sus estudios por falta de recursos económicos y además porque tuvo que asumir el papel de padre y madre con sus hermanos ya que se quedaron huérfanos a corta edad. Actualmente está divorciada y vive con su hija menor Diana en el sector sur de la Capital de los ecuatorianos; en Quito, específicamente en Chillogallo. Hasta hace pocos el sector sur de la ciudad de Quito, no era tomado en cuenta dentro de los sectores económicos fuertes de la capital de la República del Ecuador, ahora este sector es considerado una fuerza de la economía de la ciudad. En este lugar se encuentran familias emprendedoras que han luchado para sobresalir. Entre nativos y migrantes de otras ciudades y países, ha sido el punto de encuentro de habitantes de varias provincias, y está reconstruido con extensas calles. 
Sandra desde hace 12 años estableció un negocio de venta de frutas y verduras, uno de los obstáculos más grandes que ha tenido y que significaron un monto de dinero significativo, fue cuando detectaron a su hija mayor un cáncer el cual fue tratado y ahora ella se encuentra estable con su salud. Sandra aprendió esta actividad con su tía que le enseñó desde muy niña sobre los proveedores, las cuentas, etc. Sandra lo desarrolló por sus hermanos para sacarlos adelante y luego por sus hijos. Es un trabajo muy duro pues requiere de esfuerzo físico para cargar las cajas de frutas y luego clasificarlas, y aun el horario de trabajo requiere mucha fuerza de voluntad, pues al menos Sandra invierte 12 horas cada día, desde que empieza a amanecer a la una de la madrugada, hasta las 13H00 o más. Sandra pide ayuda para obtener un préstamo el cual lo dedicará a comprar al por mayor frutas de temporada que son muy demandadas por los clientes. Los ingresos extra que se generen los invertirá en el crecimiento de su negocio y en la educación superior de su hija menor. Sandra dice que espera dejar huella en sus hijas y que cuando ellas se sientan realmente realizadas estén convencidas que su madre cooperó para llegar hasta allí, es por eso que inclusive planea capacitarse en donde aceptaron confiar en ella para prestarle el dinero, en Fundación Alternativa una intermediaria de Kiva que capacita y fortalece los negocios de emprendedores con el objetivo de disminuir la pobreza en el país.
texts.en:
Among the challenges all Ecuadoreans face to overcome the threat of poverty day to day is Sandra, a 42-year-old woman with many stories to tell but what’s now of concern is her present and her and her daughters’ future who even though they are now adults Sandra still hopes to see them reach their dreams since for her it was difficult to complete her schooling for lack of economic resources and because she took on the role of father and mother for her siblings since they were orphaned at a young age.  She’s currently divorced living with her youngest daughter, Diana, in the southern part of Quito, Ecuador’s capital city, specifically in Chillogallo.  Until a short time ago, the southern section of Quito wasn’t much of a strong economic sector in the capital of the Republic of Ecuador.  Now, it’s considered to be an economic strong point in the city’s economy.  Enterprising families are found here that have struggled to stand out.  It’s been a meeting point for natives and migrants from other cities and countries and for people from several provinces; it’s been rebuilt with broad streets.

Sandra started a fruit and vegetable business 12 years ago and one of the biggest obstacles she’s faced and one that meant a significant expenditure of money was when her oldest daughter was diagnosed with cancer which was treated and she’s now in stable health.  

Sandra learned this activity from her aunt who taught her since she was a young girl about suppliers, accounts, etc.  Sandra developed it for her siblings so that she could move them forward and later she did it for her children.  It’s very hard work that requires physical effort to lift the boxes of fruit to sort them and even the schedule requires much willpower because Sandra invests at least 12 hours daily from the moment she starts at one a.m. and goes until one p.m. or even later.

Sandra is asking for help to get a loan to buy seasonal fruit that has high customer demand at wholesale.  Extra income generated will be invested in her business’ growth and in her youngest daughter’s higher education.  Sandra says that she hopes to leave a print on her daughters so that when they are completely fulfilled they’ll be sure to realize that their mother contributed to their getting there; this is why she’s even planning on getting training where she was trusted enough to be lent the money at Fundación Alternativa which is a Kiva intermediary that trains and strengthens entrepreneurs’ businesses aiming at lessening poverty in the country.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Mame Coumba

texts.fr: Mame Coumba est une femme mariée qui habite au Sénégal. Elle évolue dans le secteur des services. C’est une coiffeuse qui a une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans son activité. Elle est  sociétaire dans l’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC de la localité ou elle vit. Elle a déjà remboursé un prêt antérieur et sollicite un crédit de 300 000 prévus pour l’aménagement de son salon de coiffure. Les revenus que lui procure son activité lui permettent de supporter les charges de ses 3 enfants en plus de la location du salon ou elle pratique son activité. Ce financement pourra l’aider à attirer davantage la clientèle, d’accroitre ses revenus et de mieux faire face a ses charges quotidiennes. Son plus grand rêve est de disposer du plus grand salon de coiffure du quartier.
texts.en: Mame Coumba is a married woman who lives in Senegal. She works in the services sector. A hairdresser, she has over ten years of experience in this business. She is an associate of one of the U-IMCEC branch offices in the town where she lives. She has already prepaid a previous loan and is requesting a loan of 300,000 for fixing up her hair salon. The revenues her business brings in enable her to support her three children in addition to covering the rent for her salon, where she does business. This financing will help her to draw in more customers, increase her revenues, and cope better with her day-to-day expenses. Her greatest dream is to have a larger hair salon in the area.

loans.use: to renovate her hair salon

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: Graciela, de 20 años, es una señorita muy amable, buena y trabajadora, es soltera pero tiene un pequeño hijo de 1 año, vive a lado de su madre y su hermano en su casa propia y juntos comparten su lucha para seguir adelante. El trabajo de Graciela consiste en la compra y venta de madera, compra trozos de los diferentes aserraderos que están ubicados cerca de su vivienda y los lleva a procesar en su taller hasta obtener piezas simples ya sea en listones y tablas, de ahí coloca todo lo obtenido en su almacén en donde los vende de manera individual. Todo esto proceso lo realiza entre los aserraderos y la venta es en su casa, lleva trabajando de esta forma desde hace 1 año y le está yendo bien. Esta muy contenta de que le este yendo bien, ya que tiene un buen margen de ganancias por las ventas que realiza ya que utiliza todo el producto, ahora que desarrolla este trabajo no tiene que esperar solo el dinero que genera su ex esposo ya que ella también puede colaborar con la economía del hogar, tiene el apoyo incondicional de su ex esposo y juntos trabajan para poder brindar lo mejor a su familia. Por tanto desea solcitar 2,500  soles comprará madera para empezar de nuevo con el proceso y convertirlos en listones y tablas.
texts.en:
Graciela, 20, is a very kind, good, hardworking young woman.  She’s single but has a little one-year-old son.  She lives with her mother and brother in their own house and they all share the struggle to get ahead.  

Graciela’s work consists in buying and selling lumber.  She buys chunks of wood from various sawmills located near her house and she takes them to her workshop to process into simple pieces, either slats or boards.  She then places everything she makes in her warehouse and then sells them from there individually.  She does all this process between the sawmills and the sales point at home.  

She’s been working this way for a year and is doing very well.  She’s very happy that she’s doing well because her profit margin is good since she uses up all her product.  Now that she’s doing this work, she does not have to wait for the money her ex husband earns since now she too can contribute to her home’s economy.  She has her ex husband’s unconditional support and they work together to provide all the best for their family which is why she’s asking for a 2,500 sol loan to buy lumber to start the process of turning it into slats and boards again.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Nogaye

texts.fr: Madame Nogaye est mariée et  habite au Sénégal. Elle évolue depuis plus de 7 ans dans le secteur du commerce. Elle s’adonne à la vente de tissus et de parfums. Elle est mère de 3 enfants âgés entre 3 et 15ans. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour le renforcement de son fond de roulement. Une partie du financement servira a acheter de tissus et des parfums a revendre, l’autre partie lui permettra de développer sa nouvelle activité de vente de petit déjeuner. Son objectif final consiste a accroitre le niveau de ses bénéfices pour mieux faire face a ses dépenses. Son intention étant aussi de diversifier  les produits et services qu’elle offre a sa clientèle, elle souhaite disposer dans le futur d’un toit  pour a famille.
texts.en: Ms. Nogaye is married and lives in Senegal. She has been working in the commercial sector for over seven years. She devotes all her time to selling cloth and perfumes. She is the mother of three children from 3 to 15 years old. She is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs for bolstering her working capital. Part of the financing will be used to purchase cloth and perfumes to resell. And the other part will enable her to develop her new business selling breakfasts. Her end goal includes boosting her profits to cope better with her expenses. In addition, intending to diversify the products and services offered to her customers, she would like a roof for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and perfumes for resale and then to start a business selling breakfasts

loans.name: Lidia Edel

texts.es:
Lidia tiene 37 años de edad,  vive con su esposo y sus dos menores hijos a su cargo. Viven en casa propia. La casa está ubicada en el Caserío Malingas Grande perteneciente al Distrito de Tambogrande. Lidia vive en la parte  rural  del distrito y cuenta con vivienda de material rustico de la zona y con el servicio de luz.

La actividad que desarrolla Lidia es el negocio de crianza y la posterior venta de animales menores y aves de corral, los comercializa en su casa y zonas aledañas. Lidia atiende permanentemente y cuenta con clientela ya establecida. Ademas tiene 1 Ha.  de terreno agrícola que es herencia cultivado con mango y limón.  Lidia tiene experiencia de más de 04 años en los negocios de agropecuario.   Adicionalmente su esposo tiene 1 Ha.  De terreno agrícola que es heredado en la zona de San Martín.

Lidia desea comprar alimento balanceado para su ganado, es por ello que ha solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para lograr su propósito.
texts.en:
Lidia, 37, lives with her husband and two minor children who are in her care in her own house located in Caserío Malingas Grande that belongs to Tambogrande District.  Lidia lives in the rural part of the district and her house is made from insubstantial materials; it has electricity.

The activity Lidia carries out is raising small farm animals and barnyard fowl for subsequent sale.  She sells them at home and in adjacent zones.  She tends permanently and has an established clientele.  She also has one hectare of farmland she inherited where she grows lemons and mangoes.  Lidia has more than 4 years’ experience in agriculture and animal husbandry businesses.  In addition, her husband owns a hectare of land he inherited in the San Martín zone.

Lidia wants to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed for her livestock and this is why she’s asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2,000 new sol loan to reach her objective.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
Delfina is taking a loan of $1,000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) to improve her business. Delfina has eight children and a husband. She is a very hardworking woman. 
Delfina will use the loan to buy doughnuts, cigarettes, rice, fish canes and other stock to keep in her kiosk. 
She hopes that she will make more income in order to support her family and send her children for a good education.

loans.use: to buy doughnuts, cigarettes, rice, fish canes and other stock to resell.

loans.name: Gredel

texts.es:
Gredel, de 42 años, es una mujer buena, amable y alegre, esta casada con Kelin y fruto de su matrimonio tiene dos hijos de 23 y 21 años de edad, vive en una casa propia en donde comparte sus días a lado de sus dos hijos y su esposo con quien trabajó mucho para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y para que no les falte nada.
El trabajo de Gredel, consiste en la venta de diversos productos, entre las cosas que vende tiene productos de belleza, perfumería, cosméticos, y mas, además de prendas de vestir de temporada que trae de otras ciudades para venderlos bajo el sistema crediticio entre sus amigas, vecinas, familiares y compañeros de trabajo. Lleva realizando esta actividad por mas de 20 años y le esta yendo muy bien, además de cumplir esta labor también es profesora de un centro educativo de la ciudad y eso le permite tener potenciales clientes y vender más aparte de cumplir con su trabajo. Inició su actividad cuando vio la necesidad de solventar los gastos sus estudios, ya que en ese entonces aun era estudiante y necesitaba tener algún ingreso económico, poco a poco fue progresando, hasta que egresó y pudo también trabajar paralelamente en lo que había estudiado, pero aun así siguió con su trabajo comercial ya que le brinda buenas ganancias, tiene muchos planes a futuro, espera seguir trabajando y generar recursos económicos para su hogar. Este es el crédito numero 3 con MFP, por ello se siente agradecida con las personas que le brindan el financiamiento que necesita para que pueda concretar sus planes. Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará productos de belleza, cosméticos y perfumería para poder vender, además adquirirá algunas prendas de vestir para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gredel, 42, is a good, kind, cheerful woman married to Kelin; they have two children who are 23 and 21 years old.  She lives in her own house where she shares her days with her two children and her husband with whom she worked much to improve their quality of life and so that they would have no unmet needs.

Gredel’s work consists in selling various products.  Among the things she sells are beauty products, perfume, cosmetics and more; she also sells seasonal clothes that she brings from other cities to sell to her girlfriends, neighbors, family members and coworkers on credit.  She’s been doing this for more than 20 years and is doing very well.  In addition to this work, she’s also employed as a teacher at a local school which gives her potential customers and while doing her job she’s able to sell more.

She started this activity when she needed to pay for her schooling since back then she was still a student and needed a source of income.  She gradually made progress until she graduated and was able to also work in her profession.  But even so, she continued with her commercial work because it produces good profits.  She has many future plans and hopes to continue working and generating income for her home.

This is MFP loan #3 and she’s grateful to the people who are making this financing possible that she needs to be able to reach her objectives.  She will use the requested 2,500 soles to buy beauty products, cosmetics and perfume to sell and she’ll also buy some articles of clothing to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and clothes.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan tiene 52 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de chincha, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, así como también por la alegría de sus pobladores; Juan es un hombre muy trabajador, sobre todo porque es padre de 2 maravillosos hijos y junto a su esposa realizan todos los esfuerzos por darle a su familia una vida digna.  Día con día Juan se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente a la siembra de algodón, desde hace 15 años, él le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 9 horas al día, el siempre está al pendiente de su cultivo y por ello el cree que le va bien en su negocio por su dedicación y sus ganas de salir adelante.

Juan está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes, entre otros para poder mejorar su cultivo y tener una buena cosecha, con lo cual seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Construir su casa de material noble ya que actualmente es de adobe y darle una buena educación a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Juan, 52, lives in the city of Chincha that’s noted for its warm, welcoming climate as well as for the cheerfulness of its inhabitants.  Juan’s a very hardworking man above all because he’s the father of two marvelous children and together with his wife they focus all their efforts into giving their family a life with dignity.  

Juan works day to day in agriculture, especially growing cotton.  He’s been doing this for 15 years and spends about nine hours daily at work.  He’s always watchful of his crops and this is why he believes he does well in his business, because of his dedication to it and his desire to get ahead.

Juan is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he’ll be able to buy manure and fertilizer, among others, to improve his crops and have a good harvest; he will continue striving towards making his greatest dream reality: to build his house out of substantial materials because it’s currently adobe and to give his children a good education.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer, among others.

loans.name: Clavel Group

texts.es: Julissa tiene 29 años de edad, es miembro del Grupo Solidario Clavel, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, son una familia muy luchadora y responsable. Ella inicio su negocio vendiendo golosinas y jugos, luego decidió vender comida y el negocio le resulto por lo que en la actualidad se dedica a la venta de carne asada y golosinas, su horario de atención es de 4:00 pm a 10:00 pm. El préstamo que solicita Julissa lo invertirá en la compra de productos como ser: carnes, frijoles, manteca, vegetales, queso, que es para elaborar la comida que ofrece a sus clientes. Con el apoyo de este préstamo podrá ofrecer más producto a su clientela. El único inconveniente que se le presenta a Julissa es la competencia ya que hay un lugar cerca donde venden golosinas por lo que ella busca vender su producto de calidad para que no le afecte en sus ventas. Su meta es establecer un restaurante para atender mejor a sus clientes y ofrecer mas productos que satisfagan los deseos de su clientela. Es el primer financiamiento que Julissa solicita en FAMA y espera cancelar sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en: Julissa, 29, is a member of the “Clavel” (Carnation) communal bank; she’s married and her husband is a merchant.  They are a hardworking, responsible family.  She started her business selling snacks and juices and then decided to sell food and the business had good results so she still is selling grilled meat and snacks.  She’s open to the public from 4pm until 10pm.  The loan Julissa is requesting is to buy products like meat, beans, lard, vegetables and cheese to make the food she offers her customers.  With support from the loan she will be able to offer more products to her clientele.  The only inconvenience Julissa faces is competition since there’s another place nearby that sells snacks which is why she tries to sell top quality products so her sales won’t be affected.  Her goal is to open a restaurant to better care for her customers and offer more products that will satisfy their wishes.  This is Julissa’s first loan request to FAMA and she expects to make her installment payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy meat, cheese and beans, among others.

loans.name: Lidia Susana

texts.es:
Lidia es una mujer ecuatoriana joven de 35 años, se casó muy joven pero terminó sus estudios secundarios, actualmente está separada de su pareja y está dedicada a sacar sola adelante a sus 3 hijos que tienen 13, 9 y 6 años. Aunque la separación fue una prueba muy difícil tanto para sus hijos como para ella, juntos han formado una familia ejemplar. Viven en el barrio de Chimbacalle que está ubicado en el sector sur de la ciudad de Quito, capital de la República del Ecuador. Hasta hace pocos años el sector sur de la ciudad de Quito, no era tomado en cuenta dentro de los sectores económicos fuertes de la capital de la República del Ecuador, ahora este sector es considerado una fuerza de la economía de la ciudad. En este lugar se encuentran familias emprendedoras que han luchado para sobresalir. Entre nativos y migrantes de otras ciudades y países, ha sido el punto de encuentro de habitantes de varias provincias, y está reconstruido con extensas calles. Chimbacalle en donde reside Lidia, es un barrio con una alta actividad comercial que es cada vez más fortalecida y que aporta en gran manera al crecimiento económico de la ciudad. Se destaca en esta zona los parques con amplias zonas verdes en los cuales se dan cita las familias los fines de semana. Hay gran accesibilidad a todo tipo de servicios y sus habitantes son emprendedores que aprovechan cada oportunidad que se presenta con establecimiento de nuevos negocios. Ventas  ambulantes, niños trabajando, familias con necesidad son muchos de los cuadros que se visualiza en este sector. 
Lidia se dedica a la venta ambulante de ropa casual desde hace 5 años, este emprendimiento fue muy importante para ella, pues sería el sustento para ella y sus hijos a partir de la separación, si bien es cierto, antes se dedicaba a estas ventas como un hobby para aportar con un ingreso adicional a su hogar, luego se convirtió en su trabajo a tiempo completo y ahora son esos ingresos los que proveen de educación y bienestar a sus hijos. En un inicio, solo vendía cosméticos pero sus clientes demandaban también ropa y ahora, cada día dedica desde 6 o más horas a recoger pedidos de sus clientes, a clasificar la ropa nueva que tiene, a entregar el pedido en la dirección de cada cliente, a cobrar las cuentas pendientes. Todo esto, sin descuidar la atención a sus hijos ayudándoles con las tareas, revisando y estudiando con ellos. Lidia solicita un crédito para comprar mercadería al por mayor y así obtener mayores descuentos en su factura final, de esta forma su ganancia incrementará y así un día podrá cumplir su sueño de tener su propio almacén de ropa, el cual le sustentará para darles a sus hijos la oportunidad de conseguir un título profesional que les lleve muy alto. Lidia agradece que Fundación Alternativa le brindó confianza para obtener este crédito con el que además obtuvo asesoría para visionar y proyectar su negocio a futuro.
texts.en:
Lidia is a 35-year-old Ecuadorian woman. She married young, but she was able to finish high school. She’s currently separated and raising her children on her own – they’re 13, 9 and 6 years old. Although the separation was a difficult time for her children and herself, together they have since become an exemplar family. They live in the Chimbacalle neighborhood that’s located in the south of the city of Quito, which is the capital of the Republic of Ecuador. Up until the last few years, the southern part of Quito was not considered as playing a major part in the economy of the city, but now it’s considered one of the city’s economical strengths. In this area you’ll find determined families who have fought to get ahead. From natives to migrants from other cities and countries, this area has been the meeting point of people from various provinces and has been reconstructed with extensive streets. Chimbacalle, where Lidia resides, is a very commercial neighborhood that is constantly growing and lends itself to the economic growth of the city. There are parks with big green spaces where families meet on the weekends. There is access to a great number of services and the people in this area, with determination, use every opportunity that presents itself to establish new businesses. In this area, you will see street vendors, working children and families in need.
Lidia is a street vendor and she's been selling casual clothing for 5 years. This undertaking was very important for her, as it was the only livelihood she had for her herself and her children since the separation. Previous to the separation, she worked as a street vendor and brought in some extra money, but it was more of a hobby; afterwards it became her fulltime job and the income now provides the education and wellbeing of her children. In the beginning, she sold only cosmetics, but there was demand for clothing, so she now dedicates about 6 hours or more each day to taking down orders from her clients, classifying the new clothing she has, delivering the orders to each address and collecting outstanding accounts. All of that work, while still attending to her children; helping them with homework, going over lessons and studying.
Lidia is requesting a loan to buy wholesale merchandise in order to get more discounts on her final bill. This will help increase her earnings so that one day she can accomplish her dream: owning her own clothing store that will help sustain her family and provide her children the opportunity to earn professional degrees that will take them further in life. Lidia is grateful that Fundación Alternativa believed in her enough to provide her with a loan and the training needed to visualize and project her business into the future.

loans.use: buy wholesale clothing, cosmetics and jewelry.

loans.name: Elizabeth Rosaura

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos a su cargo, tiene casa propia, sin embargo vive con su madre en el Sector La Campiña en Cayaltí, ubicado a 1 hora de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

Elizabeth se dedica desde hace 4 años a la venta de de productos de belleza.  Paralelamente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, los mismos que alimenta hasta que alcancen tamaño y peso ideal para su posterior venta.  Con los ingresos que recibe apoya en la manutención de su familia.

Elizabeth necesita comprar más productos de belleza para su posterior venta, además de comprar animales para engorde y posterior venta también.  Es por ello que para lograrlo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 42 years old, married and has three dependent children. She owns her home, nevertheless she is living with her mother in Sector La Campiña in Cayalti, located one hour from Chiclayo, the capital of the department of Lambayeque.

Elizabeth has been selling beauty products for four years. She also raises and sells farmyard animals. She feeds them until they reach an ideal size and weight. She supports her family with her earnings.

Elizabeth needs to purchase more beauty products to sell and also more animals to fatten  for sale. Consequently she is requesting a loan of S/. 2,000 from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products and animals for later re-sale.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene carga familiar directa.  Vive en casa propia, ubicada en el Caserio Sialupe Huamantanga perteneciente a Lambayeque.  Santos vive en la zona rural del distrito de Lambayeque,   cuenta con servicios de agua y luz , el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 50  familias.
  
La actividad que desarrolla Santos, es la crianza y comercialización  de animales, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años, el negocio está situado en su domicilio, aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro.   Este negocio  cuenta con competencia  pero también cuenta con un amplio mercado para su desarrollo.  Cuenta con ingresos adicionales producto por actividades relacionadas  a la agricultura.

Santos desea comprar cerdos y pavos para comercializarlos en esta navidad y con esto incrementar sus ventas.  Es por ello que ha solicitado un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Santos, 26, is single and has no direct dependents.  He lives in his own house located in Caserío Sialupe Huamantanga belonging to Lambayeque.  Santos lives in the rural part of Lambayeque District and has running water and electricity; the place is small community of about 50 families.

The activity Santos carries out is raising and selling animals.  He’s been in this business for ten years.  The business is located at home.  He learned it from his parents, that is to say, he knows it to perfection.  This business has competition but it also has a large market to develop in.  He earns extra income in activities related to agriculture.

Santos wants to buy pigs and turkeys to sell for Christmas and increase his sales this way which is why he’s asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1,000 new sol loan to reach his objective.

loans.use: to buy pigs and turkeys to sell for Christmas.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
